section.title: User Contribution
section.para: User contribution is a big part of Majisti. In fact, the entire library is driven by it since it only provides tools for modularity. With no modules contributed well... no modularity is really achieved!

We believe that concentrating on one simple and very concrete tasks is what is the easiest for developpers hence most people are making websites on the fly - maybe using a framework - but still coding until it is done. Using abstraction is harder and requires more time and most of the time the end customer for the website does not really care about the abstraction used within his website since usually that abstraction can even be used again for his competitors! Business modeling is what usually is the most interresting since its the making of something new, based on the current knowledge and experience in the ways of creating something by expending that knowledge and gaining more experience. But business modeling usually covers so much of areas where everything must be focussed on the end user. So, how can we achieve everything without going insane?

User contribution. Very well known by the open source community. By using modularity most of the business model is solved up with already contributed modules which are already proven successfull and working and the use case modeling sums up of configuring those modules and coding the models related to that business. In fact, after designing those models, the only thing left is building the actual website and its layout, provided you don't use the default templates shipped with the standard distribution! The key is to concentrate on business modeling.

Majisti is using a proposal system which promotes user contributed modules so that the most popular ideas climb up the ladder as fast and possible and gather the maximum number of developers. With your reputation it is even possible to feedback on a proposed component by suggesting more interesting ideas. More on that on the actual website.
